parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Stable Diffusion",
  "details": {
    "framework": "PyTorch",
    "resource_requirements": {
      "nodes": 20,
      "gpus_per_node": 8,
      "cpus_per_gpu": 4,
      "slurm_partition": "compute-od-gpu",
      "slurm_job_name": "stable-diffusion-512cont-improvedaesthetic",
      "mpi_library": "IntelMPI",
      "nccl_library": "AWS OFI NCCL",
      "efa_library": "Amazon EFA",
      "communication_protocol": "NCCL",
      "communication_mode": "RDMA",
      "data_transfer_mechanism": "SHM",
      "master_address": "MASTER_ADDR",
      "master_port": 12802,
      "world_size": "WORLD_SIZE"
    },
    "scripts": [
      "/fsx/stable-diffusion/stable-diffusion/scripts/slurm/resume_512_improvedaesthetic/launcher.sh",
      "/fsx/stable-diffusion/stable-diffusion/scripts/slurm/resume_512_improvedaesthetic/launcher2.sh"
    ]
  }
}
```

This script runs a Stable Diffusion model using the PyTorch framework and utilizes NCCL for distributed training. It requires 20 nodes, each with 8 GPUs and 4 CPUs, and leverages the compute-od-gpu partition within the SLURM cluster. 

The script sets up the necessary environment variables for IntelMPI, NCCL, and EFA. It then defines variables for the distributed training environment, such as `MASTER_ADDR`, `MASTER_PORT`, and `WORLD_SIZE`.  Finally, the script utilizes `mpirun` to run the `launcher2.sh` script for distributed training across the defined nodes.
